servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P2227: Barometric Pressure Circuit Range / Performance

entry.ptxt: This DTC is detected if any one of the following conditions is met.

item.ptxt: BARO sensor signal is out of specified range for 2 sec.
Variation of BARO sensor signal is out of specified range for 20 sec. at engine running condition.
Variation of BARO sensor signal between last driving cycle and actual driving cycle is out of specified range, and difference between measure BARO and standard BARO is more than specified valve.

entry.ptxt: BARO sensor signal voltage is lower than 0.2 V for 5 sec.
BARO sensor signal voltage is higher than 4.87 V for 5 sec.

item.ptxt: If DTC other than aimed DTC are previously detected in DTC confirmation procedure, be sure to troubleshoot DTC previously detected.
Make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Shift selector lever to 3rd range, and drive vehicle at 50 – 70 km/h (31 – 43 mile/h) for 2 min. or more. (Keep throttle valve opening constant in this step.)
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min.

testgroup.title: DTC recheck

test1.ptxt: Turn ignition switch to OFF position.
Perform DTC confirmation procedure, and check DTC.

testgroup.question: Is DTC P2227, P2228 or P2229 still detected?

testgroup.title: Troubleshooting of other DTC(s) detected at the same time
testgroup.question: Is other DTC(s) detected together?

action.ptxt: Go to troubleshooting for applicable DTC.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
